basics.name: Ahmad Ali
basics.label: Computer Science Student & Researcher
basics.summary: Bachelor of Science student specializing in Computer Science and Biology, with a focus on computational biology, machine learning, and full-stack software engineering.

work.name: Biomathematics and Fluids Group, Toronto Metropolitan University
work.summary: Implemented predictive HIV models to simulate viral rebound after treatment, utilizing solver optimization to reduce simulation time.
highlights: Developed models in Julia using DifferentialEquations.jl.
Conducted Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) simulations for parameter estimation and uncertainty analysis.
Presented research findings at Complex Systems Day at TMU.

work.name: Social Media Lab, Toronto Metropolitan University
work.summary: Contributed to the PoliDashboard server by integrating LLM-powered features and conducting data analysis for research papers.
highlights: Integrated summarization features using Hugging Face Transformers, Ollama, and OpenAI APIs.
Benchmarked multiple LLMs for performance, accuracy, and latency.
Authored literature reviews and technical reports supporting peer-reviewed research.

work.name: Career Co-op & Student Success Center, Toronto Metropolitan University
work.summary: Analyzed recruitment data to generate hiring trend reports and optimized digital resources for student use.
highlights: Analyzed over 250 job applications using Python (Pandas) and MySQL.
Redesigned the co-op skills portal, improving page load times by 40%.
Secured 5+ internship partnerships through coordination with industry and faculty.

volunteer.organization: Toronto Metropolitan Coding and Algorithms Club
volunteer.summary: Leading the development of technical programming resources for the student body.
highlights: Developed and led technical workshops focused on data structures, algorithms, and mock interviews.

publications.name: From Regression to Classification: Exploring the Benefits of Distributional Representations of Energy in MLIPs
publications.summary: This paper proposes training Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials (MLIPs) using a histogram-based cross-entropy loss instead of scalar regression[cite: 1]. [cite_start]By predicting energy distributions, the model achieves accuracy comparable to regression baselines while enabling the quantification of epistemic uncertainty through prediction entropy.

projects.name: HIV Drug Discovery Data Integration
projects.summary: Collected and standardized bioactivity data for HIV-1 Integrase and RNaseH to identify structure-activity trends.
highlights: Standardized molecular activity values for cross-dataset comparability.
Engineered molecular fingerprints using RDKit to explore chemical space.
Built Random Forest and XGBoost models to predict compound potency.

projects.name: Emotionally Responsive Robot with Multimodal Feedback
projects.summary: Designed a robotic system capable of interpreting user inputs to generate dynamic emotional feedback.
highlights: programmed an Arduino Mega to generate expressive RGB-LED patterns based on a rule-based personality model.
Co-authored a report on applying affective computing to autonomous robotics.
